summary: This is a supplemental discovery request filed by Jeffrey Epstein's defense attorneys on August 1, 2019, in his criminal case in the Southern District of New York. The letter requests the preservation and production of documents and communications from the lead prosecutor in the 2006-2008 Florida investigation, specifically concerning interactions with the Southern District of New York USAO and FBI, witness interviews, and the sharing of investigatory information.

persons.name: Martin G. Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein who authored and signed the supplemental discovery request letter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (No. 19-cr-00490) for whom this discovery request is being made.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, listed as a signatory on the discovery request letter.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein from Steptoe & Johnson LLP, listed as a signatory on the discovery request letter.

events.title: Florida Investigation of Epstein
events.description: The initial federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida.

events.title: Prosecutor's Trip to New York
events.description: A trip to New York City by the lead Florida prosecutor (AUSA) in March 2008, which is a subject of the discovery request.

events.title: Initial Discovery Request
events.description: Epstein's defense team electronically mailed their first request for discovery concerning the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).

events.title: Supplemental Discovery Request Filed
events.description: Epstein's defense attorneys file this supplemental request to particularize demands for documents from the 2006-2008 Florida investigation.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking communications and documents from the lead prosecutor in the 2006-2008 Florida investigation, specifically regarding that prosecutor's interactions with the Southern District of New York USAO and FBI.
The request seeks information about a March 2008 trip the Florida prosecutor took to New York City and any witness interviews conducted there.
The defense is inquiring about whether victim-witnesses were informed of their right to confer with a U.S. Attorney's Office other than the one in Southern District of Florida.
The request covers a broad timeframe, seeking any communications or sharing of investigatory information between the Florida and New York offices from 2007 through 2019.
The document references a prior Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), indicating the defense is investigating the circumstances and aftermath of that earlier deal.
